text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Kuwait's press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Former deputy Ali al-Baghli challenges the results of the October 7 parliamentary elections.
- The International Investor, a Kuwaiti Islamic investment firm, plans to liquidate a local property investment fund.
- Kuwaiti and Japanese businessmen meet on Tuesday to discuss expanded cooperation.
- Iraq fails to clear doubts about banned missiles, United Nations official says.
- Three shops closed down for selling lottery coupons.
The Gulf Arab state sees lottery activities as a form of gambling that is prohibited by Islam.
